response:
The presence of multifocal CNS deficits (optic nerve and spinal cord) separated in space in a 45-year-old female is highly suggestive of an inflammatory demyelinating disorder. Multiple Sclerosis is the most common cause, but Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD) and MOG Antibody Disease (MOGAD) must be considered given the simultaneous or sequential involvement of the optic nerve and spinal cord.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis (MS)", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "MOG Antibody Disease (MOGAD)", "Idiopathic Transverse Myelitis", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)"]
